questions.question: What does 'ISO' in photography refer to?
options: Internal Shutter Opening
Image Stability Option
International Standards Organization
Image Sensor Optimization

questions.question: What is the rule of thirds in photography?
options: A rule stating a photo should be divided into three parts
A guideline proposing that an image should be imagined as divided into nine equal parts by two equally spaced horizontal lines and two equally spaced vertical lines
A technique where the camera is divided into three pieces for better handling
A rule that states the camera settings should always be in multiples of three
questions.correct_answer: A guideline proposing that an image should be imagined as divided into nine equal parts by two equally spaced horizontal lines and two equally spaced vertical lines

questions.question: What does 'bokeh' refer to in photography?
options: The way the lens renders out-of-focus points of light
A black and white photo
A special kind of camera tripod
A technique for panoramic shots
questions.correct_answer: The way the lens renders out-of-focus points of light

questions.question: What is 'Circle of Confusion' in the context of photography?
options: A psychological state when a photographer cannot decide on the composition
A type of lens defect leading to blurred images
An optical spot caused by a cone of light rays from a lens not coming to a perfect point
A group of photographers specializing in circular formations
questions.correct_answer: An optical spot caused by a cone of light rays from a lens not coming to a perfect point

questions.question: What is the 'Sunny 16 Rule' in photography?
options: A rule for setting shutter speed on a sunny day
A guideline that sets the aperture at f/16 on a sunny day
A post-processing technique for sunny photographs
A camera setting for taking photos in bright sunlight
questions.correct_answer: A guideline that sets the aperture at f/16 on a sunny day

questions.question: What is 'reciprocity failure' in film photography?
options: The failure of a camera to properly sync with a flash
The phenomenon where extra exposure time is needed for long exposures due to reduced film sensitivity
A failure in the film development process
A problem with digital-to-analog conversion in hybrid cameras
questions.correct_answer: The phenomenon where extra exposure time is needed for long exposures due to reduced film sensitivity

questions.question: What is 'infrared photography'?
options: Photography using light from the infrared spectrum
A style of photography that emphasizes warm colors
A post-processing technique to add heat maps to images
A type of photography used mainly for scientific research
questions.correct_answer: Photography using light from the infrared spectrum

questions.question: What is the 'Bayer Filter' in digital photography?
options: A filter used to enhance colors in digital cameras
A mosaic of tiny colored filters placed over the pixel sensors of an image sensor to capture color information
A filter applied in post-processing to correct white balance
A protective filter placed over camera lenses
questions.correct_answer: A mosaic of tiny colored filters placed over the pixel sensors of an image sensor to capture color information

questions.question: What is the 'Schneider Kreuznach' phenomenon in photography?
options: A type of lens flare specific to Schneider Kreuznach lenses
A rare optical effect found in high-quality lenses, leading to exceptionally sharp images
A manufacturing defect found in some Schneider Kreuznach lenses in the 1970s
A renowned style of portrait photography developed by Schneider Kreuznach
questions.correct_answer: A rare optical effect found in high-quality lenses, leading to exceptionally sharp images

questions.question: What is 'Zernike phase contrast' in the context of photography?
options: A technique used in microscopy to convert phase shifts in light passing through a transparent specimen to brightness changes in the image
A rare camera setting for enhancing contrast in low-light conditions
A post-processing method for adjusting phase contrast in images
A historical method of developing photographs using phase transition
questions.correct_answer: A technique used in microscopy to convert phase shifts in light passing through a transparent specimen to brightness changes
